clean_content:
Definition / general

* Reactive gingival proliferation characterized by spindle cell proliferation with calcification or ossification

Essential features

* Reactive gingival lesion; thought to be associated with chronic irritation* Spindle cell proliferation with calcification or ossification within gingival connective tissue

Terminology

* Other terms include peripheral cementifying fibroma, peripheral cemento-ossifying fibroma, ossifying fibrous epulis, calcifying fibrous epulis ([J Indian Soc Periodontol 2014;18:527](25210274))* Should not be confused with odontogenic / central bone tumors, such as ossifying fibroma and cemento-ossifying fibroma

ICD coding

* ICD-10:
  + [K06.8](https://www.icd10data.com/ICD10CM/Codes/K00-K95/K00-K14/K06-/K06.8) - other specified disorders of gingiva and edentulous alveolar ridge+ [K13.6](https://www.icd10data.com/ICD10CM/Codes/K00-K95/K00-K14/K13-/K13.6) - irritative hyperplasia of oral mucosa

Epidemiology

* More common in females (F:M = ~2:1) ([Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol 1987;63:452](3472146), [Med Oral Patol Oral Cir Bucal 2022;27:e460](35717619), [J Indian Soc Periodontol 2015;19:83](25810599), [Pediatr Dent 2001;23:245](11447957))* Second to fourth decades (children and young adults) ([Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol 1987;63:452](3472146), [Med Oral Patol Oral Cir Bucal 2022;27:e460](35717619), [Br J Oral Maxillofac Surg 2019;57:1081](31601435))* Can occur at any age, reports range from 2 months to 87 years ([Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol Oral Radiol 2020;130:e74](32107185), [Med Oral Patol Oral Cir Bucal 2022;27:e460](35717619))* ~5% of oral hyperplastic lesions ([Braz J Otorhinolaryngol 2019;85:399](29705120), [Indian J Dent Res 2018;29:61](29442089), [Acta Odontol Latinoam 2015;28:103](26355878))* ~20% of gingival hyperplastic lesions ([Quintessence Int 2007;38:103](17263149), [J Oral Pathol Med 2010;39:631](20456619))

Sites

* Arise exclusively on the gingiva
  * Maxilla more common than mandible ([Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol 1987;63:452](3472146), [Pediatr Dent 2001;23:245](11447957))* ~67% in incisor cuspid region ([Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol 1987;63:452](3472146), [Med Oral Patol Oral Cir Bucal 2022;27:e460](35717619), [J Indian Soc Periodontol 2015;19:83](25810599))

Pathophysiology

* Unknown, likely a reaction to chronic irritation ([J Indian Soc Periodontol 2015;19:83](25810599))* Hormonal influence has been proposed since the lesion is common in adolescents and young women ([Niger Med J 2011;52:35](21968923))
    + However, lesional cells do not express estrogen or progesterone receptors (ER / PR) ([J Oral Sci 2010;52:95](20339239))

Etiology

* Associated with chronic irritation, poor dentition and dental prosthetics, especially if poorly fitted ([J Indian Soc Periodontol 2015;19:83](25810599))* Thought to arise from the periodontal ligament ([Ann Diagn Pathol 2020;46:151510](32252013))

Clinical features

* Slow growing nodule with a mean time to presentation of 16 months ([Med Oral Patol Oral Cir Bucal 2022;27:e460](35717619))* Generally painless or causing mild discomfort ([J Indian Soc Periodontol 2015;19:83](25810599))* May ulcerate ([Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol 1987;63:452](3472146))* Indolent clinical course but in some cases, the size and location may interfere with normal oral function, displace teeth and distort local anatomy ([Int J Surg Case Rep 2021;84:106127](34153696), [Ann Maxillofac Surg 2016;6:300](28299276), [Head Neck Pathol 2013;7:356](23857548))* Recurrence in ~15% despite surgical excision ([Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol 1987;63:452](3472146), [Br J Oral Maxillofac Surg 2019;57:1081](31601435), [J Indian Soc Periodontol 2015;19:83](25810599))* Multifocal disease is rare ([Indian J Dent Res 2014;25:220](24992855))

Diagnosis

* Difficult to distinguish clinically from other entities (pyogenic granuloma, oral irritation fibroma, giant cell fibroma, peripheral giant cell granuloma, metastatic lesions)* Readily diagnosed histologically with high interobserver concordance ([Med Oral Patol Oral Cir Bucal 2022;27:e460](35717619))

Radiology description

* May show irregular radiopacity due to calcification / ossification or show mild alveolar bone resorption ([Dentomaxillofac Radiol 2007;36:180](17463105), [Med Oral Patol Oral Cir Bucal 2022;27:e460](35717619), [Head Neck Pathol 2013;7:356](23857548))

Radiology images

Contributed by Molly Housley Smith, D.M.D.  

[![Visible ossification](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityperipheralossifyingfibromasmith06.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityperipheralossifyingfibromasmith06.jpg)

Visible ossification

Prognostic factors

* Benign but may recur* Recurrence is more likely if offending irritant is not removed ([J Indian Soc Periodontol 2015;19:83](25810599))

Case reports

* 2 month old girl with peripheral ossifying fibroma ([Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol Oral Radiol 2020;130:e74](32107185))* 24 year old man with multifocal disease ([Indian J Dent Res 2014;25:220](24992855))* 25 year old woman with 4 cm tumor interfering with oral function ([Int J Surg Case Rep 2021;84:106127](34153696))

Treatment

* Surgical excision ([J Indian Soc Periodontol 2015;19:83](25810599))* Removal of irritants including plaque / calculus or poorly fitted prosthetics ([J Indian Soc Periodontol 2015;19:83](25810599))

Clinical images

Contributed by Molly Housley Smith, D.M.D.  

[![Nodular mass](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityperipheralossifyingfibromasmith01.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityperipheralossifyingfibromasmith01.jpg)

Nodular mass

[![Multilobular red growth](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityperipheralossifyingfibromasmith02.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityperipheralossifyingfibromasmith02.jpg)

Multilobular red growth

  
  
Images hosted on other servers:  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityperipheralossifyingfibromapmc01.jpg)](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/35717619/#&gid=article-figures&pid=figure-1-uid-0)

Typical clinical appearance

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityfibroidepulisclinical1.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3361788/figure/F1/)

17 year old boy

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityfibroidepulisclinical2.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3556846/figure/fig1/)

21 year old man

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityfibroidepulisclinical3.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3556846/figure/fig2/)

25 year old man

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityfibroidepulisclinical4.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3556846/figure/fig3/)

26 year old man

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityfibroidepulisclinical5.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3556846/figure/fig4/)

31 year old man

Gross description

* Exophytic mass that may be sessile or pedunculated ([Med Oral Patol Oral Cir Bucal 2022;27:e460](35717619), [J Indian Soc Periodontol 2015;19:83](25810599))* Mean size of < 2 cm but sizes up to 10 cm have been reported ([Med Oral Patol Oral Cir Bucal 2022;27:e460](35717619), [J Indian Soc Periodontol 2015;19:83](25810599), [Ann Maxillofac Surg 2016;6:300](28299276))

Gross images

Contributed by Molly Housley Smith, D.M.D.  

[![Partially calcified mass](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityperipheralossifyingfibromasmith03.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityperipheralossifyingfibromasmith03.jpg)

Partially calcified mass

Microscopic (histologic) description

* Variably cellular fibroblastic spindle cell proliferation in subepithelial connective tissue in variably collagenous background ([J Indian Soc Periodontol 2015;19:83](25810599))
  + Collagen deposition is more prominent in the deep aspect ([J Indian Soc Periodontol 2015;19:83](25810599))* Dystrophic calcification, lamellar or woven bone formation is essential for diagnosis ([J Indian Soc Periodontol 2015;19:83](25810599))* Overlying hyperplastic epithelium with hyperkeratosis ([J Indian Soc Periodontol 2015;19:83](25810599))
      + Surface epithelium may be ulcerated ([J Indian Soc Periodontol 2015;19:83](25810599), [Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol 1987;63:452](3472146))* Background contains variable chronic inflammatory infiltrate, predominantly lymphoplasmacytic and proliferating small capillary sized vessels ([J Indian Soc Periodontol 2015;19:83](25810599), [Med Oral Patol Oral Cir Bucal 2022;27:e460](35717619))

Microscopic (histologic) images

Contributed by Timothy Fielder, M.B.B.S., B.Med.Sci., Ruta Gupta, M.D. and Molly Housley Smith, D.M.D.  

[![Well demarcated mucosal lesion](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityperipheralossifyingfibromafieldergupta01.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityperipheralossifyingfibromafieldergupta01.jpg)

Well demarcated mucosal lesion

[![Ulceration](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityperipheralossifyingfibromafieldergupta02.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityperipheralossifyingfibromafieldergupta02.jpg)

Ulceration

[![Metaplastic ossification](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityperipheralossifyingfibromafieldergupta03.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityperipheralossifyingfibromafieldergupta03.jpg)

Metaplastic ossification

[![Ossification and calcification](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityperipheralossifyingfibromafieldergupta04.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityperipheralossifyingfibromafieldergupta04.jpg)

Ossification and calcification

[![Lamellar bone](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityperipheralossifyingfibromafieldergupta05.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityperipheralossifyingfibromafieldergupta05.jpg)

Lamellar bone

  

[![Collagenous matrix](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityperipheralossifyingfibromafieldergupta06.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityperipheralossifyingfibromafieldergupta06.jpg)

Collagenous matrix

[![Woven bone](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityperipheralossifyingfibromafieldergupta07.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityperipheralossifyingfibromafieldergupta07.jpg)

Woven bone

[![Peripheral cemento-ossifying fibroma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityperipheralossifyingfibromasmith04.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityperipheralossifyingfibromasmith04.jpg)

Peripheral cemento-ossifying fibroma

[![Cementum-like bone](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityperipheralossifyingfibromasmith05.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityperipheralossifyingfibromasmith05.jpg)

Cementum-like bone

Positive stains

* Not used in routine diagnosis* [SMA](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsalphasmoothmuscleactin.html) in 73% ([Br J Oral Maxillofac Surg 2019;57:1081](31601435))* [CD68](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd68.html) in 54% ([Br J Oral Maxillofac Surg 2019;57:1081](31601435))* [SATB2](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainssatb2.html) in 100% ([Head Neck Pathol 2022;16:339](34224081), [Ann Diagn Pathol 2020;46:151510](32252013))* Positive for osteoblastic / cementoblastic proteins **RUNX2**, **BMP2**, **CAP** in one study and **osterix (OSX)** in another ([J Oral Pathol Med 2015;44:628](25359431), [Braz Oral Res 2017;31:e53](28678972))

Negative stains

* [ER](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainser.html) / [PR](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsprog.html) ([J Oral Sci 2010;52:95](20339239))* [ALK](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsalk.html) ([Br J Oral Maxillofac Surg 2019;57:1081](31601435))

Sample pathology report

* Gingiva, excision:
  + Peripheral ossifying fibroma (see comment)+ Comment: Sections include oral squamous mucosa with underlying connective tissues and show features of a peripheral ossifying fibroma. The mucosa shows focal ulceration with organizing granulation tissue. The submucosal tissues show a well demarcated but unencapsulated lesion composed of areas of fibrosis and metaplastic ossification. There is no dysplasia or malignancy.

Differential diagnosis

* [Oral irritation fibroma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/oralcavityirritationfibroma.html):
  + Clinically difficult to distinguish+ Histologically lacks calcification or bone formation* [Peripheral giant cell granuloma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/oralcavityperipheralgiantcellgranuloma.html):
    + Clinically difficult to distinguish+ Stromal multinucleated giant cells are seen on histology* [Pyogenic granuloma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/oralcavitypyogenicgranuloma.html):
      + Clinically difficult to distinguish+ Lobulated vascular proliferation on histology* [Giant cell fibroma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/oralcavitygiantcellfibroma.html):
        + Clinically difficult to distinguish+ Lacks bone formation
